Acknowledging that in a dictatorship which lasted for DATE , minor involvement with the regime was frequent , it considered that the applicant ’s position as a secret informant of the state security service did not itself suffice to trigger the application of that provision . This could be assumed when a secret informant voluntarily reported on others and the reports could potentially cause persecution by the state security service .
